2023-10-06.name: Apple Festival
2023-10-06.summary: It's the 62nd year of this big festival on Lake Superior, which features  orchard tours, history  walks, an apple-peeling contest, live music and a big parade at 2 p.m.  Sunday.

2023-10-06.name: Scarecrow Weekend
2023-10-06.summary: There's a big scarecrow contest plus a             carnival, music, dance, children's activities and the Autumn on the Fox arts show in this town west of Chicago.

2023-10-06.name: Pumpkin Festival & Skeleton Invasion
2023-10-06.summary: Every year, this northern suburb of Chicago tries to break the record for most lighted jack-o-lanterns. In addition to all-you-can-carve stations, there will be costume, pie-eating and carving contests.

2023-10-06.name: Twin Cities Oktoberfest
2023-10-06.summary: This festival at the Minnesota State Fairgrounds features craft beer, music, dancing and such competitions as stein-holding and nail-striking.

2023-10-06.name: Chain O' Lakes Blues Festival
2023-10-06.summary: Listen to the blues at the historic Indian Crossing Casino.

2023-10-06.name: Midwest Viking Festival
2023-10-06.summary: The University of Wisconsin-Green Bay hosts this free outdoor festival that celebrates the crafts, food and traditions of medieval Scandinavia. Events include battle demonstrations.

2023-10-07.name: Apple Festival
2023-10-07.summary: It's the 62nd year of this big festival on Lake Superior, which features  orchard tours, history  walks, an apple-peeling contest, live music and a big parade at 2 p.m.  Sunday.

2023-10-07.name: Rivertown Fall Art  Festival
2023-10-07.summary: This juried arts festival along the banks of the St. Croix River includes music and food vendors.

2023-10-07.name: Autumn on Parade
2023-10-07.summary: There's a market, Fun Zone for kids, classic car and tractor show, entertainment stage, beer garden and a parade at 1 p.m. Sunday.

2023-10-07.name: Oktoberfest
2023-10-07.summary: This festival just north of Milwaukee features music and food plus goofy contests: best lederhosen/dirndl, sauerkraut-eating, a German spelling bee and a live Glockenspiel show.

2023-10-07.name: Apple Affair
2023-10-07.summary: In the bluffs above Trempealeau, this festival features a 10-foot apple pie, a hunt for a Silver Apple, a race of floating wooden apples and a bicycle tour with a 20-mile route through apple orchards and hillier 35- and 60-mile routes.

2023-10-07.name: Scarecrow Weekend
2023-10-07.summary: There's a big scarecrow contest plus a             carnival, music, dance, children's activities and the Autumn on the Fox arts show in this town west of Chicago.

2023-10-07.name: Pumpkin Festival & Skeleton Invasion
2023-10-07.summary: Every year, this northern suburb of Chicago tries to break the record for most lighted jack-o-lanterns. In addition to all-you-can-carve stations, there will be costume, pie-eating and carving contests.

2023-10-07.name: Galena Country Fair
2023-10-07.summary: There's a juried fine arts/arts and crafts fair, farmers market, wine garden, bake shop, music and children's games in Grant Park.

2023-10-07.name: Burgoo Festival
2023-10-07.summary: The street party in this northern Illinois town, gateway to Starved Rock State Park, features vats of "pioneer'' stew, a crafts fair and music.

2023-10-07.name: Cranberry Fest
2023-10-07.summary: In this northeast Wisconsin lakes town, there will be marsh tours, music, a cranberry beer and wine garden, an antiques market, fiber-art show and crafts fair.

2023-10-07.name: Twin Cities Oktoberfest
2023-10-07.summary: This festival at the Minnesota State Fairgrounds features craft beer, music, dancing and such competitions as stein-holding and nail-striking.

2023-10-07.name: Oktoberfest
2023-10-07.summary: There will be music, food and free pumpkins on downtown streets.

2023-10-07.name: Big Island Rendezvous and Festival
2023-10-07.summary: This southern Minnesota festival is great for families, with a voyageur encampment of more than 1,000 reenactors dancing, demonstrating, competing and pulling visitors back into the fur-trade era.

2023-10-07.name: Fermentation Fest
2023-10-07.summary: This fest in the scenic hills of southwest Wisconsin is not only about pickles and sourdough bread but also cheese, chocolate, beer and wine. There will be demos, tastings, music, and art in Witwen Park.

2023-10-07.name: Giant Pumpkin Fest
2023-10-07.summary: This town near Wisconsin Rapids calls itself the Giant Pumpkin Capital of Wisconsin and features a pumpkin-pie eating contest, pumpkin rolling and carving, a carnival and craft show.

2023-10-07.name: Chain O' Lakes Blues Festival
2023-10-07.summary: Listen to the blues at the historic Indian Crossing Casino.

2023-10-07.name: Harvest & Wine Festival
2023-10-07.summary: This Lake Michigan beach town offers wine and craft-beer tasting, hay rides, pumpkin painting, live music and fine arts.

2023-10-07.name: Pumpkin Patch Festival
2023-10-07.summary: There'll be music, children's games and arts and crafts in this Door County village.

2023-10-07.name: Harvest Fest
2023-10-07.summary: On the 400 Block downtown, there will be free pumpkins, kids' tractor pulls, a petting zoo and other children's activities.

2023-10-07.name: Midwest Viking Festival
2023-10-07.summary: The University of Wisconsin-Green Bay hosts this free outdoor festival that celebrates the crafts, food and traditions of medieval Scandinavia. Events include battle demonstrations.

2023-10-08.name: Summit Hill House Tour
2023-10-08.summary: This self-guided tour of homes on one of the nation's best-preserved Victorian streets is held only once every few years.

2023-10-08.name: Oktoberfest
2023-10-08.summary: There will be music, food and free pumpkins on downtown streets.

2023-10-08.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2023-10-08.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2023-10-08.summary: This southern Minnesota festival is great for families, with a voyageur encampment of more than 1,000 reenactors dancing, demonstrating, competing and pulling visitors back into the fur-trade era.

2023-10-08.name: Pumpkin Patch Festival
2023-10-08.summary: There'll be music, children's games and arts and crafts in this Door County village.

2023-10-08.name: Harvest Fest
2023-10-08.summary: See old-time artisanry at the Swiss Historical Village, including sausage-stuffing and cheese-making in the 1890s cheese factory.

2023-10-28.name: Thrills & Chills
2023-10-28.summary: This downtown Halloween party features a costume parade, make-your-own treat bags, haunted house, pumpkin carving and trick-or-treating from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.

2023-10-28.name: Halloween
2023-10-28.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2023-10-28.name: Pumpkin Festival
2023-10-28.summary: This fall fest features arts and crafts shows, carnivals, a historic-house walk and a big parade on Sunday.

2023-10-28.name: Earth Wood & Fire Artist Tour
2023-10-28.summary: Visit artists in their studios in and around Lake Mills, Cambridge and Fort Atkinson, between Madison and Milwaukee.

2023-10-28.name: Halloween Outdoor Puppet Extravaganza
2023-10-28.summary:
The BareBones puppet troupe's annual pageant will be held on the Midtown Greenway again, with music, dance, stilt-walking, fire and song.
To be sure of tickets, reserve ahead.

2023-10-28.name: Halloween Parade
2023-10-28.summary: The town's annual parade along Main Street starts at 6:30 p.m.

2023-10-28.name: Jack O'Lantern Days
2023-10-28.summary: There will be a costume parade and contest, pumpkin carving, trick or treating and a haunted trail.

2023-10-28.name: UFO Day
2023-10-28.summary: There's a craft fair, kids' games and music, but the 1 p.m. parade is the main event in this riverside village just south of Madison, where residents reported more than a dozen UFO sightings in the winter of 1987.

2023-10-28.name: BatFest
2023-10-28.summary: This Fox River town hosts a pumpkin roll, pumpkin-carving battles, "Thriller'' dance, costume contests, bat meet-and-greet and a parade.

2023-10-28.name: Day of the Dead
2023-10-28.summary: In Old Town Mankato along Riverfront Drive, there will be a mariachi band, Aztec and folklore dancers, a Mexican wrestling ring, a makers' market and children's activities and treats.

2023-10-13.name: Covered Bridge Studio Tour
2023-10-13.summary: This studio tour in eastern Wisconsin includes more than 60 artists in Cedarburg, Grafton, Port Washington, Mequon, Thiensville and Newburg.

2023-10-13.name: Chicago International Film Festival
2023-10-13.summary: Watch more than 80 films and 60 programs of shorts from around the world.

2023-10-13.name: Apple Festival
2023-10-13.summary: In this Lake Michigan town, there's a pumpkin-carving contest, children's activities and an arts and crafts show.

2023-10-13.name: Fall Festival
2023-10-13.summary: This Door County festival features pumpkin bowling, a derby race, chainsaw carving, a  pingpong-ball drop and a parade at 11 a.m. Saturday.

2023-10-13.name: Iowa City Book Festival
2023-10-13.summary: The first North American town to be named a UNESCO City of Literature offers talks, readings, panels, exhibits and a walking tour of literary Iowa City.

2023-10-13.name: Scenic Drive Festival
2023-10-13.summary: In the southeast corner of Iowa, 11 villages feature quilt shows, scarecrow contests, bake sales, tours of  historic sites, wine tasting and street fairs.

2023-10-14.name: Covered Bridge Studio Tour
2023-10-14.summary: This studio tour in eastern Wisconsin includes more than 60 artists in Cedarburg, Grafton, Port Washington, Mequon, Thiensville and Newburg.

2023-10-14.name: Madison County Covered Bridge Festival
2023-10-14.summary: John Wayne was born there, George Washington Carver lived there and the famous covered bridges still are there. The festival in this town southwest of Des Moines features guided bus tours to the bridges, free horse-drawn wagon rides to Wayne's house, Old West shootouts, live music and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2023-10-14.name: Harvest Fest
2023-10-14.summary: In this river town, there will be a pumpkin pie-eating contest, a pumpkin regatta on the St. Croix, a microbrew tasting and a pedal tractor pull.

2023-10-14.name: Red Wing Arts Fall Festival
2023-10-14.summary: More than 100 artist booths line four blocks of this Mississippi River town. There's also music and food.

2023-10-14.name: Chicago International Film Festival
2023-10-14.summary: Watch more than 80 films and 60 programs of shorts from around the world.

2023-10-14.name: Apple Festival
2023-10-14.summary: In this Lake Michigan town, there's a pumpkin-carving contest, children's activities and an arts and crafts show.

2023-10-14.name: Open House Chicago
2023-10-14.summary: The Chicago Architecture Foundation sponsors this free, behind-the-scenes peek at more than 200 mansions, clubs,  churches, hotels and theaters.

2023-10-14.name: Fall Festival

2023-10-14.name: Jack O' Lantern Festival
2023-10-14.summary: There's a pumpkin-carving and scarecrow-making contests, kids' inflatables, pumpkin roll and, in the evening, a zombie run in the forest, bonfires and live music.

2023-10-21.summary: This downtown festival near Lake Geneva features wine and beer tasting, music, a car show, arts and crafts and a chili cookoff.

2023-10-21.name: Halloween
2023-10-21.summary: This town, just north of Minneapolis, calls itself the Halloween Capital of the World. Festivities include a house-decorating contest and a Grande Day Parade.

2023-10-21.summary: On the largest of the Apostle Islands, there will be a vintage-car show, cider- and soap-making, pumpkin decorating, a pie-eating contest, street vendors and a kids' costume parade.

2023-10-21.name: Oktoberfest
2023-10-21.summary: Carlos Creek Winery's brewing partner, 22 Northmen, hosts this festival, which includes a stein-holding contest, stein relays, nail-striking, axe-throwing and live bands.

2023-10-21.name: Pumpkin Chuckin Fest
2023-10-21.summary: The festival in this town, just west of Racine, features a pumpkin catapult contest, barbecue cook-off, pie auction, pumpkin-baking contest, children's games and music.

2023-10-21.name: Moose Madness Festival
2023-10-21.summary: This Lake Superior town  offers a medallion hunt, scavenger hunt, sled-dog open house, games led by Murray the Moose and activities at North House Folk School.

2023-10-21.name: Arts in the Dark Halloween parade
2023-10-21.summary: Floats, giant puppets and performances are part of the 6-8 p.m. parade along State Street.

2023-10-21.name: Civil War Encampment and Battle
2023-10-21.summary:
In this village west of Waukegan, reenactors will re-create the 1862 Battle of Shiloh, which will be narrated for spectators. 
There will also be appearances by President Lincoln, Gen. Grant and village founder Elijah Haines, as well as food and period music. Admission is free.

2023-10-22.summary: This all-ages fantasy festival in Woodstock Square features a magical talking hat, Quidditch training, an owlery, a wandering magician, a cosplay scavenger hunt and a costume parade and contest.

2023-10-01.name: Grundy County Corn Festival
2023-10-01.summary: The festival in this town on the Illinois River between Ottawa and Joliet offers stagecoach and train rides, a crackerbox derby, a pie-eating contest, music, a carnival, Saturday fireworks and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2023-10-01.name: Northeast Iowa Artists' Studio Tour
2023-10-01.summary: Drive through scenic bluff country to see 35 artists at 27 sites around Decorah, Burr Oak, St. Lucas, Waukon, West Union, Cresco, New Albin, Lansing, Elgin and Clermont.

2023-10-01.name: Door County Fall Lighthouse Festival
2023-10-01.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum sponsors tours by air, land and water to lighthouses on the peninsula, some of which can be visited only during festival weekends. Reserve as early as possible.

2023-10-01.name: Oktoberfest
2023-10-01.summary: There's German music and food at this Amana Colonies village, plus contests that include the Eisenmann, or Iron Man, competition: Teams roll kegs, walk a balance beam with full steins of beer and saw logs. The parade is at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2023-10-01.name: World Music Festival
2023-10-01.summary: More than 30 artists and ensembles from 22 countries perform at the Chicago Cultural Center and other venues.

2023-10-01.name: World War II Days
2023-10-01.summary: Midway Village Museum hosts one of the largest World War II battle re-enactments in the nation, with more than 1,200 uniformed re-enactors and more than 60 vintage tanks and other armored vehicles.

2023-10-01.name: Harvest Fair
2023-10-01.summary: This free festival at the Wisconsin State Fairgrounds features lumberjack shows, pumpkin bowling, scarecrow-making, kids' rides and entertainment on three stages.

2023-10-01.name: Fall Village Market
2023-10-01.summary: This town west of Madison offers vintage and handmade goods, live music and food trucks.
